lines.text: You know, everybody dies. My parents died. Your father died. Everybody dies. I'm going to die too. So will you. The thing is, to have a life before we die. It can be a real adventure having a life.
No, Mom, that's the oldest profession.
Are you gonna go to sleep or you gonna stay up and think your weird thoughts?
I'll stay up and think weird thoughts for a while.
Gradual school. Mommy say's she teaches at gradual school.
Oh Gradual school is where you go to school and you gradually find out you don't want to go to school anymore.
I mean, I had mine removed surgically under general anesthesia. But to have it bitten off in a Buick...

[after being told he shouldn't go to his Mom's feminist memorial]
I will grieve alone for the rest of my life, but right now I want to be around people who loved her.
[while telling Dean Bodger and her son about his father, who was a brain damaged WW2 veteran with spontaneous erections she was the nurse of]

Thank you. He was dying. I wanted a child. It was a good way to have one without the bother of a husband around... who had legal rights to my body. So, one night at work... when the wounded and maimed were all asleep, I went to him. He was asleep. But his erection was there, as always. I removed my undergarments and climbed on top of him. He woke up then. He said the only word other than his name that I ever heard him utter. He said, "good." It didn't take very long, and that once was all that was needed.
You raped him! You raped a dying man!

[telling Garp he cannot go to his mother's feminist memorial]
They're not going to allow any men. A man *killed* her! They're very *upset*!

[to his mother Jenny]
I never needed a father.

[to his infant son in baby carriage]
Don't be a baby, Duncan! Say da-da!

[to Roberta]
Hey you! Dildo. Is this the nut house where you're keeping my Laurel?
Laurel's here but we're not exactly keeping her.
I'm not a dyke. Is Laurel expecting you?
That's all you men understand is violence.
Now look. I know what sort of freaks hang around here. It's a big lesbian scene.
Ooooh, oooh, what are you the man of the house or the court eunuch. Laurel, you in there you bitch!
Oh, I know who you are. My Laurel's not your type sweetie.
Perhaps she's not your type either.
Listen, goddammit. If you don't get Laurel's ass out here I'm gonna...
Oh, I don't think I can drive the fuckin' car.
That's alright. I can drive you just never let me.
[In pain as Laurel helps him to the car]
We'll take the house. Honey, the chances of another plane hitting this house are astronomical. It's been pre-disastered. We're going to be safe here."
Men die young in my family, Helen!
